parameters.name: clientNamespace
parameters.description: Uniquely identifies the client's Dayforce instance. Is needed to login.

400.description: Request is malformed.  Correct and resubmit.

parameters.name: documentGuid
parameters.description: Uniquely identifies the document you want to retrieve. Partial search is not supported, so provide the full value. Otherwise, a 400 error will be returned.

parameters.name: clientNamespace
parameters.description: Uniquely identifies the client's Dayforce instance. Is needed to login.

200.description: Returns the document identified by the documentGuid

400.description: Request is malformed.  Correct and resubmit.

401.description: User is unauthorized to retrieve the required document.

parameters.name: employeeXRefCode
parameters.description: Uniquely identifies the employee whose document you want to retrieve. Partial search is not supported, so provide the full value. Otherwise, a 400 error will be returned.

parameters.name: clientNamespace
parameters.description: Uniquely identifies the client's Dayforce instance. Is needed to login.

200.description: Returns documents associated with the employeeXRefCode.

400.description: Request is malformed.  Correct and resubmit.

parameters.name: employeeNumber
parameters.description: Employment identification number assigned to an employee.  A partial value can be provided for a wider search.

parameters.name: employmentStatusXRefCode
parameters.description: A case-sensitive field containing employment status values, which can be client-specific. Use a ContextDate value to search for employees with a given status as of a point in time. Otherwise, the search will use the current date and time.

parameters.name: orgUnitXRefCode
parameters.description: A case-sensitive field that identifies a client's organizational units. Use this to search all levels of the employees’ organization including department, location, region, corporate, etc. Use a ContextDate value to search for employees with a specific value as of a point in time.  Otherwise, the search will use the current date and time.

parameters.name: filterHireStartDate
parameters.description: Use to search for employees whose most recent hire date is greater than or equal to the specified value (e.g. 2017-01-01T13:24:56). Use with filterHireEndDate to search for employees hired or rehired in a given timeframe.

parameters.name: filterHireEndDate
parameters.description: This date is used to search for employees whose most recent hire date is less than or equal to the specified value.  Typically this parameter is used in conjunction with FilterHireStartDate to search for employees hired or rehired in a given timeframe. Example: 2017-01-01T13:24:56

parameters.name: filterTerminationStartDate
parameters.description: This date is used to search for employees with termination date values greater than or equal to the specified value.  Typically this parameter is used in conjunction with FilterTerminationStartDate to search for employees terminated in a given timeframe. Example: 2017-01-01T13:24:56

parameters.name: filterTerminationEndDate
parameters.description: This date is used to search for employees with termination date values less than or equal to the specified value.  Typically this parameter is used in conjunction with filterTerminationStartDate to search for employees terminated in a given timeframe. Example: 2017-01-01T13:24:56

parameters.name: filterUpdatedStartDate
parameters.description: The beginning date used when searching for employees with updates (and newly effective records) in a specified timeframe.  When a value is provided for this parameter, a filterUpdatedEndDate value must also be provided. Because this search is conducted across all entities in the HR data model regardless of whether the requesting user has access to them, it is possible that the query will return XRefCode of employees with changes in which the consuming application is not interested.  Example: 2017-01-01T13:24:56

parameters.name: filterUpdatedEndDate
parameters.description: The end date used when searching for employees with updates (and newly effective records) in a specified timeframe.  When a value is provided for this parameter, a filterUpdatedStartDate value must also be provided.   Example: 2017-01-01T13:24:56

parameters.name: contextDate
parameters.description: The Context Date value is an “as-of” date used to determine which employee data to search when records have specific start and end dates.  The service defaults to the current datetime if the requester does not specify a value.  Example: 2017-01-01T13:24:56

parameters.name: clientNamespace
parameters.description: Uniquely identifies the client's Dayforce instance. Is needed to login.

200.description: A collection of Employees XRefCodes meeting the search criteria.

400.description: Request is malformed.  Correct and resubmit.

parameters.name: employee
parameters.description: The JSON-formatted content containing the data entities and elements to be processed in POST (hire and rehire ) and PATCH (employee update) operations.  For more information and examples, please refer to the Dayforce Web Services RESTful Developer's Guide.

parameters.name: isValidateOnly
parameters.description: When a TRUE value is used in this parameter, POST (hire and rehire ) and PATCH (employee update) operations validate the request without applying updates to the database.

parameters.name: clientNamespace
parameters.description: Uniquely identifies the client's Dayforce instance. Is needed to login.

200.description: An Employee is created, no response body.

400.description: Request is malformed.  Correct and resubmit.

parameters.name: xRefCode
parameters.description: The unique identifier (external reference code) of the employee to be retrieved.  The value provided must be the exact match for an employee; otherwise, a bad request (400) error will be returned.

parameters.name: contextDate
parameters.description: The Context Date value is an “as-of” date used to determine which employee data to search when records have specific start and end dates.  The service defaults to the current datetime if the requester does not specify a value.  Example: 2017-01-01T13:24:56

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: This parameter accepts a comma-separated list of top-level entities that contain the data elements needed for downstream processing.  When this parameter is not used, only data elements from the employee master record will be included.  For more information, please refer to the Introduction to Dayforce Web Services document.

parameters.name: clientNamespace
parameters.description: Uniquely identifies the client's Dayforce instance. Is needed to login.

200.description: The Employee with the requested XRefCode.

400.description: Request is malformed.  Correct and resubmit.

parameters.name: employee
parameters.description: The JSON-formatted content containing the data entities and elements to be processed in POST (hire and rehire ) and PATCH (employee update) operations.  For more information and examples, please refer to the Dayforce Web Services RESTful Developer's Guide.

parameters.name: xRefCode
parameters.description: The unique identifier (external reference code) of the employee to be retrieved.  The value provided must be the exact match for an employee; otherwise, a bad request (400) error will be returned.

parameters.name: isValidateOnly
parameters.description: When a TRUE value is used in this parameter, POST (hire and rehire ) and PATCH (employee update) operations validate the request without applying updates to the database.

parameters.name: clientNamespace
parameters.description: Uniquely identifies the client's Dayforce instance. Is needed to login.

200.description: The Employee is updated, no response body.

400.description: Request is malformed.  Correct and resubmit.
